ahoi tmopsʉ, yʉmeʉmʉ to ’oyomia tmopsʉ ’o lema’cohio, mainca ’o letaayaezoi, “yac’ʉ! m’ohkuyu!”
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”
我今天七點到學校。: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」

mimza tmunoi ho mainca, “’aveoveoyʉ lema’cohio.”
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」

mo seolʉa no tmopsʉ, isi pa’cohivi to lema’cohi tala hia tmasvʉtʉ no buacou.
In class, the teacher taught us the Cou language of numbers.

mimza tmu’ofehni to lema’cohio ho engha, mimza pasu tmasvʉtʉ.

mo man’i ’o os’o pelʉi ci h’oe’ea cou.

la’u huhucmasi uhne ’oyona tmopsʉ, la’u huhucmasi aʉsvʉtʉ buacou, te’ola esvʉtneni to ino’u.

’a mo’o ’o ongko’u.

’a pasuya ’o ongko to amo’u.

’a sayungu ’o ongko to ino’u.

mi’ocu tomaska ta tonsoha maitan’e.
I am 10 years old.
我今天七點到學校。: 我今年10歲。

mo cihi ’o ohaeva’u atai ’o ongkosi, mitacu tomaska veaucni.
I have a brother, his name is atai, he is 11 years old.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個哥哥，他叫atai，他今年11歲。

mimza yontomo conci ’oyonatmopsʉ.

a’o ho ohaeva’u lamza na’no kaebʉ pasunaeno.
Both my brother and I like to sing.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。

la’u kaebʉ yuhnguzu, homo seolʉa tosvo, lamza nʉtʉ ’o mimza conoemoo ho yuhnguzu.
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。

la’u kaebʉ ho mi’o ea faeva ci nanghia, temiala melʉ toehungu pasunaeno ho yuuhnguzu.
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。

’a oko no cou ao’.

我今天七點到學校。: 我是鄒族的小孩。

mo yone saviki ’o emoomza.
Our family lives in saviki.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們家住在saviki。

mo eimo ’o mimza conoemoo.

我今天七點到學校。: 我們家共有五個人。

mo tuyu ’o mimza nanat’ot’ohaesa.

我今天七點到學校。: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。

a’o ho amo, ino, ohaeva no hahocngʉ ho ohaeva no mamespingi lamza noteuyunu.

我今天七點到學校。: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。

mo bankake ’o amo’u, zou lesmo’eisi ’o amo’u.

mo kʉehoi ’o ino’u, zou leaotothomʉ ’o ino’u.

’o amo hola yontoemoo lasi uaneni buacou a’mi.

ho lamza tosvo lamza acʉhʉ maine’e ne huehungu.

a’o ho ma’ahaeva lamza tʉtpʉtʉ to kio.

la’u na’na ʉmnʉa ‘o cou to emoo’u.

mimza yuyuso ’e ino ho covnʉ maitan’e.

na’no tatposa ’e pepe homo hie, o’amo soyʉmʉ o’amo mu’ei, na’no sohuyu ’e poepe.
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

mimza yootamo yaakukuzo ci ceoaho yaa bobonʉ, sliʉa ta hia co feango, na’no noyano.

ataveisi no cohzona, smoefʉhngya ’epepe.
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.
我今天七點到學校。: 下午，天空變紅了。

os’o tuocosi ’e ino, mancis’a smoefʉhngoya ’epepe.
I asked my mother why the sky is red.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。

yainca ta ino, teasonʉ cmu’ho na cmoehu.

我今天七點到學校。: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。

uk’a ci meipeipi ta engʉca homo yofna, micu yuyafo si congeoha.
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

tetocu maezocu maine’e.
We were going home too.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們也要回家了。

smaimio ta ceono maine’e, mi’o mi’unu to feohʉ m’ea tooyokeo.
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,
我今天七點到學校。: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。

atva’esi ʉmnʉ ote esmi na cmoehu, mi’on’a mici mimiyo.
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

’o la’u yoni ci ’oyonatmopsʉ mo nocmu’u to emoo’mia, la’u huhucmasi coeconʉ ho uhto ’oyonatmopsʉ, maezo la’u coeconʉ ho main’e.

o’a mo meoisi ’o lamza yoni ci ’oyonatmopsʉ, o’amo botngonʉ ’o ’o’okono tmopsʉ, lamza acʉhʉ yupa bobohngʉ.
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。

la acʉhʉ yu’eteyunu to ’oyonayoyaso ’o ’o’oko, toehungu peispak’i to ma’li, noteuyunu ho aumomotʉ’ʉ.

我今天七點到學校。: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。

la maezo tes’upu ’amia ’o lema’cohio ho peispak’i, zou cono emoo ’e ’oyonatmopsʉ.

lamza huhucmasi ateoteop’ʉcʉ, la acʉha tusi’nga ho poa cofkoya ’ola ’oyonavenkio.

pantola mahisi to pethʉ’ta, pantola tusi’ngi to aukukuyungu.
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.
我今天七點到學校。: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。

lamza na’a tusi’nga ’o maucuculili to ’oyonatmopsʉ, lamza aangaeza ’ote hioa, huhucmasi na’no cofkoya ’o ’oyonatmopsʉ.

ne hucma, mi’o uhto huehungu ho aitia ’o ak’i.
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。

micu noana’o ho o’ana mimza ahtu yupa bobaito, os’o na’na taecingia.

aiti to ak’i a’o, osnia pa’ni to vahatʉ a’o, pema to ’ocea.
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.
我今天七點到學校。: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。

na’no cohʉmʉ ’o isi emʉ’a to ak’i ci vahatʉ, aʉmtʉ na’no mafe.

我今天七點到學校。: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。

os’o yaeza ʉmnʉa ’o ’ocea to ak’i, maezo mafe ho isi ima.
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.
我今天七點到學校。: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。

cu cohiona, mimza iepoepohʉ ’o ba’i ho apapeipei’i tote ana no cohzona.
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.
我今天七點到學校。: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。

na’no toemamave ’o bai homo apapeipei’i to ’oanʉ no cohiona, mo yaa yoskʉa, yaa teo’ua, yaa pusiahʉa, maezo yaa kokeut’ee.

oepʉngʉ ocohioni, mimza uhto chachae ho toa chae
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.
我今天七點到學校。: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。

man’i ’o isi yaa to ba’i ci f’ue, ucei ho t’ocnga faeni a’o, pahafneni a’o maine’e.

mimza yupa tooyokeo, tamzala vohvaho no ta’esi ho aiti hin’i.

maitan’e hafa to lema’cohio amia ho uhto ’oyonayuansou, mimza bitoyange to phingi ho mhia ki’pu.

oh’aemonʉ to ’oyonayuansou, yainca to lema ’cohio “e tu’cusi zou mazozomʉ, f’uhusi zou mafkofkoi, temu iachi bobaito.”
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back
我今天七點到學校。: so you can visit them yourself.""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35533/5: 進入動物園後，老師說:「前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。」

la’u’so smoyo to fkoi, ko’ko o’a te’o baito to fkoi.
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.
我今天七點到學校。: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。

man’i ’o os’o aiti ci zomʉ, mo meiavovei to ma’e’evi ’o mazozomʉ, maezo baito to puku cimo yoto feongo to evi ho oengʉtʉ.

我今天七點到學校。: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。

’o ’aemona to ’oyonayuansou mo ya ckiu, ’uma ho e’uho, o’amo’ucula ahtu baito tamo maica ci yuansou, kaebʉ ho mi’o bobaito maitan’e.
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.
我今天七點到學校。: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。

man’i ’o os’o hu’ongki, ta’u poa aitneni to ino ho amo.
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

tamzala nʉthʉ ’e ino ho amo ho i’vaho uhtan’e no ta’esi.
Next time I will come with my parents.
我今天七點到學校。: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。

h’otosvo maitan’e, momza yuyuso ’o ohaeva no’u mamespingi uhne maibayu ho aiti ‘o amoconi.
This holiday, my sister and I went to Chiayi to visit my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 這個假日，我和姊姊去嘉義拜訪叔叔。

mimza ’i’mi ne taipahu ho yonto kuyai no tacvoh’i ho uhne maibayu.
We took the train from Taipei to Chiayi.

mimza cu sʉcʉhʉ ne maibayu, poʉtʉcʉ to kuyai ’o amoconi uhto ’letosvakuyai ho suputi amia.

我今天七點到學校。: 到了嘉義，叔叔開車來車站接我們。

o’amo nomcovhi to ’oyona letosvakuyai ’o emoo to amoconi, homo poʉt’ʉcʉ to kuyai moc’o osni sʉcʉhʉ.
The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.
我今天七點到學校。: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。

cum’u to emoo to amoconi pantomo meoino leaʉtʉcʉ moatʉ’nʉ, mimza smopayo to zitensa ho uhto leaʉtʉcʉ moatʉ’nʉ.
There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。

yonto meoino leaʉtʉcʉ moatʉ’nʉ, hafa to amoconi a’mia ho p’onʉ ’to moat’ʉnʉ ho smopayo to uma.
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.
我今天七點到學校。: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。

micu yofna, mimza evasʉzʉ ho uhto ’iciva ho eabobonʉ.
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.
我今天七點到學校。: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。

mo man’i ’o kuyai to ’iciva, ko’ko mimzac’o yonto ’otovai ho uhto ic’o.
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.
我今天七點到學校。: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。

ne temzacu mongoi, ’iamaihe peo’eoza ’o otovai’, ko’ko mimzacuc’o yonto vasu ho mongoi.
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.
我今天七點到學校。: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。

mimzacu yuovei ne taipahu, o’a imza cohivi ’o ’otovai to amoconi isicu nana ahta elʉa.
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.
我今天七點到學校。: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。

ne mo’una’a oko mosola yone tfuya’o emoomia, mo’ucula tmopsʉ, cu noezuhu ne maibayu, momeacula nochʉmʉ ne’e.
When we were young, our family lived in tfuya’o. After I started school, we moved to Chiayi and have been living in the city ever since.
我今天七點到學校。: 小時候我們家住在特富野，上學以後，就搬到了嘉義市，一直在都市裡生活。

mo’ucula tmopsʉ to taingakoo, mi’o tmopsʉ ho aʉsvʉtʉ to ceoceona no h’oyunsova ta cou, peela cohivi mo a’ʉmtʉ mav’ov’o ’o h’oyunsova ta cou ta taivang.
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.
我今天七點到學校。: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。

ko’koeno, ieni homo tosvo ta tonsoha maitan’e, mimza yuyuso ’o ohaevano’u ahocngʉ ho maine’e to huehungumia ho bobaito to mamameoi, ocia cohivi na ceoceona no h’oyunsova ta cou.
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.
我今天七點到學校。: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。

micu’so tonvoevʉhʉ ’o mameoi, at’inghi mioc’on’aso mais’a haah’o ho isi aiti.
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.
我今天七點到學校。: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。

os’o tuocosi cuma na osko peela ci e’e, mita na’no empompohsu ho mita bua cou, mita maezo meelʉ bua maaya, bua puutu ho bua sbukunu.
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in cou, as well as Japanese, Chinese and Bunun.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他會哪些語言，他的鄒語說得很流利，也會說日語、漢語和布農語。

i’mi ta hia’u tuucocosi ho cohivi, ’iama mita ahoi ho mohtan’ala oko ho aʉsvʉtʉ bua cou ho bua maaya zou sbukunu ’o vcongʉsi.
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Bunun, and he knows many Chinese at work, so he can speak so many languages.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候學鄒語和日本話，太太是布農人，而他工作上認識許多漢人，所以他會說這麼多語言。

ne miza maica yupepeahngʉyʉ, ’e mameoi mo eʉsvʉsvʉtʉ tomo man’i ci tela hia e’ohʉ ho ea fou ci a’a’ausna.
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。

e’vono o’a imza peela a’sʉftona acʉha ta’hongi, at’inghi mimza boemi to souci ho loku’in, tenamiala ivaha ʉmnʉ ci ta’lʉi.
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。

ahoi ne mo’un’a oko ho o’a o’ula cohivi na iachi ceoceona no h’oyunsova ta cou, a’ʉmtʉs’a iachi pa’hikokoe’i.
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.
我今天七點到學校。: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。

fihta hia ausuhcu man’i na isi cohivi, cohivi ho cou ’e iachi, mo na’no h’unasi ci cou a’ʉmta atva’esa itanveni ci a’a’ausna.
The more I know, the more I feel that being a cou is unique and something to be proud of.
我今天七點到學校。: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為鄒族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。

yofna maitn’e, tac’u maine’e ’o ohaesa.
My younger brother is going home this evening.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。

mimza yuyuso ’o ba’i uhto ’iciva ho mihia teo’ua, akoeva no pei’i note mafe ci oyoefona ’o ohaesa.
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。

mimza esmi ’lemhinochai, mo man’i ’omo ʉmnʉ ci chae.
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了菜攤，有好多新鮮的青菜。

mimza mihia miciveongo, f’ueofou, ho teikon.
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。

yainca to tauke tomo nocmu’u ci momhinonchae, “’e ’ungeai ho kemomo’u mo na’no cohʉmʉ ’o. ma akei mhino!”
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”
我今天七點到學校。: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」

mimza mihino to ’ungeai ho kemomo.
We bought pineapples and peaches.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。

mimza esmi tola momhino fou, yainca to tauke, “teko mihino no cuma? mo meoisi ho simeo ’e teo’ua maitan’e, mo se’tueva ’emo coni.”
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」

isi anga pepea to ba’i, tuocosi ’o tauke te ʉmnʉ oci ake’a poa cʉecʉa.
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。

at’inghi isi yainca to tauke mic na’no cʉecʉ, ’anate peela ashca poa cʉecʉa.
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.
我今天七點到學校。: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。

yainca tomo nochipi ci tauke, mihino ta yosku’u, mo meisi ho cʉecʉ ’e yosku’u.
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。

mimza atavei mihino to teo’ua maezo mihino to yoskʉ, cono panka ’o imza pe’i ci chae ne mimza cu maine’e.
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。

noana’o mooteo, cu petohʉyʉ ’eopsi.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
我今天七點到學校。: 等了好久，天已經黑了。

psoemio to memeno ’o ohaesa yainca, akameosʉ o’ate azou tosva ’e heetai, ta’esi no nicio nate’o mee’lʉ maine’e.
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.
我今天七點到學校。: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。

yainca to ba’i micu toeman’i tate ana, cu acʉhʉ yabobonʉ!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!

mimza yoho’ʉ ’to ma’o’oahngʉ maanananghia, acʉhʉ tiou tomo ʉmnʉ ci hia yaabobonʉ oyoefonʉ.
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。

mo cihi ’o mimza tmahmʉhmʉsku zou pasuya ’o ongkosi, la luema’payo’ʉ mahafa ’to macucumasi.
I have a classmate named pasuya, he often forgets to bring things.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個同學叫pasuya，他常常忘記帶東西。

ho la tmopsʉ, la mi’unu tomo tmahmʉhmʉskʉ ho yuevaho to lesmapayo’ʉ ho letposi.
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。

y’ʉnʉskʉ, i’popsohʉ, i’toteuhu, lahen’a yuvahneni to nacucuma.
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.
我今天七點到學校。: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。

ati’nghi pantolata kuici hioa, lata asngʉcʉ yuvaho to macucumahe ho oh’te yooveineni.
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.
我今天七點到學校。: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。

ko’ko o’a na ohe’la ucia poa yuvahneni to macucumahe.
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。

mosola conohiea, mozala nʉthʉhʉ mimiyo.
One day, we all went on an outing together.
我今天七點到學校。: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。

momza seolʉano emo’usnumaica, akameosʉ na’no mici te’i ’o pasuya, at’enghi ’iamamita tapayo’ʉ mahafo tola titha mahisipcoo ci kami.
On the way, pasuya wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.
我今天七點到學校。: 路途中，pasuya想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。

mita mi’usnu to mihini tmahmʉhmʉsku ’e pasuya ho yuvaho to letithamahisi teta akoyu no ohse’u, atng’ihi mo acʉhʉ mainca, maezo o’a mi’os’a mahafo.
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.
我今天七點到學校。: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。

mitacu amio tmumongsi ’e pasuya. mita sʉ’no ho mainca, maincis’a o’te poa yuvahoa to letithamahisi.
pasuya burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!
我今天七點到學校。: pasuya急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!

yainca to mihimn’i tmahmʉhmʉskʉ, ’a miko no’so ’ote iachi mahafo, a’vinano inante yuvahnenisu ci macucuma, ana tekos’a ahta yoveineni.
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!
我今天七點到學校。: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!

micu hucma tec’u uhuto ’oyonatmopsʉ, mo sʉfeʉnʉ ’o pasuya uhto ’oyonatmpsʉ, ita acʉha yoveineni to mihimni tmahmʉhmʉskʉ ’o ohtala yuvaha ci macucuma.
The next day at school, pasuya arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔天上學，pasuya很早就到學校了，pasuya把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。

mi’usnu to mihimn’i tmahmʉhmʉskʉ ho ’aveoveoyʉ ’e pasuya, mainca, ta’ucula iachi mahavo no macucuma, ’aveoveoneni to mimza tmahmʉhmʉskʉ ihingn’i yuvahneni to macucuma ne auyusi.
pasuya apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
我今天七點到學校。: pasuya向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。

leyafou to huehungu ’o amo’u.
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。

mo’un’ala oko, la e’ohʉ homo yofna ’o amo ho amoconi, la smu’iei ho teos’ofʉ.
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
我今天七點到學校。: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。

tac’u tiskova, tahecu hafa maine’e ’o ihe poumia ci yuansou.
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。

la asvʉtʉ mayo to fuzu, aasvʉtʉc’o voyʉ, la aasvʉtʉ mayo to toevosʉ.
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.
我今天七點到學校。: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。

lahe na’nosino aueva angaeza na’a, tahecu angaezneni to ma’o’oahngʉ.
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。

la’u ’aoko m’ea viho to amo, mici fiho to amo ho e’ohʉ.
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。

yainca to amo ieni ho ta’ucula saasmoyʉskʉ tasicula yuyusveni ho i’ohʉ.
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。

’o hahocngʉ to huehungu la maezo melʉ titho to h’oepona ho boepono to yuansou, la meelʉ moyai to vomʉ no h’oepona ho tocʉvʉ.
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.
我今天七點到學校。: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。

’o amo’u la saihu homo moyai h’oepona no evomʉ, yainca to amo, la titha boepono to toevosʉ eni, tetola yaeza yue’ia ’o lasi p’ecihi to yuansou, la sia to huyusi to yuansou ’o h’oepona.
My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

akoyu no aupcio mel’ʉ fiho to mamameoi ho e’ohʉ, la’u huhucmasi aʉsvʉtʉ boepono, c’o osni yaa mumza to h’oepona’u ci yuansou.
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。

mi’uni to amo’u yainca takola ahtuo’te leyaafou ci cou.
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。

mi’ocu saasmoyʉskʉ, os’o ngoevi ’o fsyunoaʉlʉ fiho to amo ho e’ohʉ.
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。

maine’e to huehungu angaeza ’o isi poumia ci yuansou ho angaezneni to ma’o’oahngʉ.
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。

yainca to amo, teto’la to’aveoveoyʉ nola pocengi, tela ko’ko man’i na teto’la tov’oha ci yuansou.
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。

mi’o poha’o ne taseona ne te’o toatmopsʉ.
I was late for school this morning.
我今天七點到學校。: 我早上上學遲到了。

me mi’o uhune ’oyonatmpsʉ, os’o ta’payo’a hafa ’o tvotposʉa.
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
我今天七點到學校。: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。

uk’a ci os’o hafa ci macucuma.
I didn’t bring anything with me.
我今天七點到學校。: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。

mo seo’lʉa no tmopsʉ, mimia iepoepohʉ baito to tposʉ ’o mimia tmepoepohʉ.
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。

sio’lʉa no hʉsvʉta, yuevaha to mimia tmaepoepohʉ ’o ’oyomza tmopsʉ’u ho ’oyomza smaofsusu.
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
我今天七點到學校。: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。

mi’uni a’o to le’aotothomʉ ho yainca, “takocula yue’ou’ou no ta’esi, ’ote na’la ’aoko poha’o!”
The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”
我今天七點到學校。: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」

’o nanghia’u zou pasuya, zou maezo oko no cou to psoseongana.
My good friend’s name is pasuya, and he is also an Cou child.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的好朋友叫pasuya，他也是鄒族的小孩。

lamia iepoepohʉ toatmopsʉ to you ne saviki.
We study together in the saviki tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們一起在山美部落讀書。

lamia asngʉcʉ iepoepohʉ tma’lʉ to mameoi hola ehohamo, lamia acʉhʉ na’no melʉ bua cou.
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Cou proficiently.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說鄒語。

mi’o na’no bankake ho maezo na’no noyʉnʉ, mita na ’no putisi ’e pasuya ho maezo na ’no kʉehoi.
I am tall and overweight, while pasuya is short and thin.
我今天七點到學校。: 我很高也很胖，pasuya很矮也很瘦。

mo na’ no peiseayayokeo ’o pasuya, la toehunga ʉmnʉa.
pasuya is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.
我今天七點到學校。: pasuya很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。

maitan’e zou meesi no ’untoo ’to ’oyona tmopsʉ, man’i ’o isi hioa ci yupatoosa’o to ’oyona tmopsʉ.
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。

moyaa yupa e’tʉyʉ, mo’potʉ to mali, toosa’o no mayahe, ’otole, pono to yanosuyu.
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
我今天七點到學校。: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。

mi’o toosa’o no peyayofʉ.
I participated in the running competition.
我今天七點到學校。: 我比賽跑步。

ne mi’o seo’lʉa no peyaofʉ, mi’o smopcuku, meoino yuhmuyu ’o ka’li.
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.
我今天七點到學校。: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。

at’inghi mi’o yac’ʉ, mi’o acʉ’cʉnʉ peyayofʉ.
But I stood up and continued running forward.
我今天七點到學校。: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。

ne mi’ocu seolʉa no toepaezumo mo acʉhʉ na’na kokaekaebʉ.
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.
我今天七點到學校。: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。

’evono o’ami’o somayahea, at’inghi mi’o na’na kokaekaebʉ, maica ho os’ocu aepʉnga na’e yupa toosa’o.
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。

ne hucma a’o ho amo imia usa aiti ’o amo’u coni.
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。

mo alolongʉ ’o t’ango to amoconi.
My uncle injured his foot.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔的腳受傷了。

isi eʉsvʉta a’mi, ’o patingsoha to sofʉ mo meoino ah’ʉtʉ.
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.
我今天七點到學校。: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。

ne isi seolʉa no teovahi ’o sofʉ. i’mi to patingsoha to sofʉ ho supeohʉ.
He fell off the roof while repairing it.
我今天七點到學校。: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。

mo mahafo to fou ‘uachumu ho fi’i ’o amo’u ho faeni to amoconi.
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。

a’o ho amoconi mimia yontola yoni amiocni ho yupeahngʉyʉ, mo man’i ’o isi aangaezneni ci h’oehohanva.
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。

auyusi ne teo’cu mongoi, emomoengʉa to amoconi ho mi’ocu yubankake, maezo asuhcu mʉʉlʉlʉ.
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.
我今天七點到學校。: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。

os’o yainca, “toteni ho tac’u yov’o ’o t’angosi, maezo sio uhta emoo’u no ta’esi.”
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」

nemoso tonsoha no 2022, ’o ’oyonatmopsʉ kaingi ho toʉsvʉsvʉtneni te peela aleonga poa ongko ta cou ’e mivunso.
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.
我今天七點到學校。: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。

os’o tuocosi ’ola auesiesi mi’usnu to ’oyonatmopsʉ ho pnanfi no tata’ia aleonga poa bua coua ’e mivnsoou ta cou ci foinana to you ci pasu’e yasiungu.
I interviewed pasu’e yasiungu, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
我今天七點到學校。: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年pasu’e yasiungu。

mimia yu’tasvʉtʉ hotena seolʉa no tosvo ho uhto emoosi ho aiti.
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

to taicosi ne os’o tucocosi, isi eʉsvʉta na isi i’mizi to ongkosi, isi yaeza poa hongneni ’o iachisi emoo ho yousi.
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。

os’o tuocosi maincis’a na’no bitotonʉ no taezuhi si ongkosu, o’amo ʉmnʉ ’o micu aesiei cila hia tmopsʉa?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?

mi’usnu a’o ho yainca, mo’so maica homo boemi to tmapuutu ho tposi ’e ongko, o’aisis’a a’sʉftona etuhca hoisi psoevaha ’e ongkosi, ’o mocmo ci cou lahen’a yainca “巴先生” i’mi tamo maica ho man’i isi koa cocvi.
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Ba Xian Sheng
我今天七點到學校。: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35533/5: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「巴先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。

yainca to pasuya, “na aʉmtʉ ongkoto ’aeno ’e isi uanenicou ho tposi ci ongko na aʉmtʉ ongkoto. ’e ongko’u zou ongko to ’oahngʉ’u, zou ongko to mimia conoemoo, zou ongko mia, tata’ia te asuhcu botngonʉ nate pela e’lʉa na iachi ongko.”
pasuya said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group
我今天七點到學校。: our family
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35533/5: our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.\""
column5: pasuya說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

ne hucma mimia yuyuso ’e ba’i ho uhtola toehunga hoteyuni mhinmhino te soovai, ’o ba’i mo mahafo to isi iachia emʉ’a ci machachae te soovai, maezo moyai to mafe cila ana to cou ci ’oanʉ ho faeni tomo batngonʉ.
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。

ihe na’na ʉmnʉa ’o soovai to ba’i, ’o cuc’u ho tomato mo botngonʉ ’omo mhino, botngonʉ ‘omo uso ho oothomʉ to isi pei’i ci chae.
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.
我今天七點到學校。: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。

’oisi pei’i ci chae hʉngʉ ho ufi na’no mafe, ho i’o isi titheni to fou fuzu ho toeteuyuni pei’i ’o ma’fʉ ci fou, ’o na’ausnasi ihe na’no kaeba tomo botngonʉ ci cou, acʉhʉ uhto soovaimia ho bitoyange.
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

nemo seolʉa no apapeipei’i ’o ba’i, mi’o yonto ciengonasi ho meukokosʉ tomo sucocafi ci cou. mi’o yonto ciengonasi tmunoi moozoyʉ, “’e chae c’o acʉha iachia emʉ’a, acʉhʉ yʉ’ʉ’ʉmni ci chae, aupcio mhino!
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown
我今天七點到學校。: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35533/5: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」

’o macucumamia c’o osnia psʉepʉngneni, yainca to ba’i, “moc’o acʉhʉ i’mi ho miso to’usnu.”
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, “It’s all thanks to your help.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」

’emo maica ci hi’hioa, mi’o tov’ohʉ ta nat’ʉca no cacʉfea ta cou ho mau’to’tohʉngʉ no ma’o’oanʉ, avinano peela cohivi na ngoseo tala soovai.
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。

aiti ’e ba’i ho lata aʉmtʉ soekaibʉ ta ma’o’oanʉ, os’o iachia na’na itanvevi ho yaa ta’usnia.
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
我今天七點到學校。: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
